title: Ian Monro
text:
Ian Scott Monro (24 October 1927 – 27 October 2014) was a New Zealand naval officer. He served in the <a href="Royal%20New%20Zealand%20Navy">Royal New Zealand Navy</a> from 1945 to 1977, and commanded for four years.
Naval career.
Monro enlisted in the Royal New Zealand Navy in 1945, training as a cadet at the <a href="Britannia%20Royal%20Naval%20College">Royal Naval College, Dartmouth</a>, temporarily housed at <a href="Eaton%20Hall%2C%20Cheshire">Eaton Hall</a>. Following his return to New Zealand he joined the survey ship HMNZS "Lachlan" and saw service in the <a href="Korean%20War">Korean War</a> on <a href="HMNZS%20Rotoiti%20%28F625%29">HMNZS "Rotoiti"</a>, before transfer to the Hydrographic Branch. He commanded HMNZS "Lachlan" from September 1965 until December 1969 and was Hydrographer RNZN for seven years.
He gained the rank of acting <a href="sub-lieutenant">sub-lieutenant</a> in 1948, <a href="Lieutenant%20%28navy%29">lieutenant</a> in 1950, <a href="lieutenant%20commander">lieutenant commander</a> in 1958, and <a href="commander">commander</a> at the end of 1966. He retired with that rank in October 1977.
In the <a href="1977%20New%20Year%20Honours%20%28New%20Zealand%29">1977 New Year Honours</a>, he was appointed an <a href="Order%20of%20the%20British%20Empire">Officer of the Order of the British Empire</a>.
Monro died on 27 October 2014.
